Back in 2017 Mrs. T. wanted her Detroit preschool class to be able to have fun and interact with friends while they learned to think plan and design. She found two big building sets with ramps and tracks that marbles and gears can roll along one that sits on the floor and one that sticks to a magnetic board. Because who doesn't like to release something at the top and watch it roll all the way down? The project was Pioneer Engineers. (More photos at the link.)  There are no words that can express my sincere gratitude for your generous donations! The impact upon my students has been incredible. For example the children have increased their vocabulary using STEM terms. One student said "You have to turn the RAMP down so the GEARS can go faster." The children are learning to take turns with the Engineer A Coaster Kit and with the Create-A Chain-Reaction Kit they are learning to collaborate. When the children first saw the materials their eyes lit up as they exclaimed "Ya look at the new toys!" I introduced the toys during large group and the children could not wait to get their hands on the materials. The entire class of 18 worked with the materials for at least 30 minutes! My next steps are to increase the complexity of play by introducing other parts of the Chain Reaction kit and different ramps with the Engineer A Coaster. I will also encourage the use of the skill building cards in both STEM kit that was provided and different sized balls and other objects to test. But most of all I plan for my students to have fun learning about Science Technology Engineering and Math!
